line_1: The way of dying is my least Concern,
line_2: That will give no Disturbance to my Urn:

line_1: Women and Wine their greatest dear Concern,
line_2: But cheat their Hopes and make an ill Return;

line_1: Says he, I long have view'd your deep Concern,
line_2: And studi'd much your Sons Disease, to learn

line_1: And thus her Letter spoke her kind Concern:
And thus her Letter spoke her kind Concern:
line_2: ' Give me not endless Cause, your Loss to mourn.

line_1: That he himself's the cause of your concern!
line_2: How great must be his sorrow then to learn

line_1: And hinted other things of high concern
line_2: For him to mention, and for her to learn;

line_1: And shew thyself unworthy my concern;
line_2: Go then, barbarian, to thy realms return,
Here I can read, and learn

line_1: But truths on which depends our main concern,
line_2: That 'tis our shame and mis'ry not to learn,

line_1: While Morals languish, a despised concern,
line_2: If anxious only that their boys may learn,

line_1: Perhaps may see in you some kind Concern.
line_2: Or others Malice, which can soon discern;

line_1: Affects indeed a most humane concern
line_2: That men if gently tutor'd will not learn,
Some Lessons of Wisdom might learn.

line_1: Her praise, or censure cannot us concern,
line_2: Nor ever penetrate the silent urn.
